actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title XVI of the Social Security Act to provide for emergency assistance grants to recipients of supplemental security income benefits, to authorize cost-of-living increases in such benefits and in State supplementary payments, to prevent reductions in such benefits because Food stamp plan of social security increases, to provide reimbursement to States for home relief payments to disabled applicants prior to determination of their disability, to decrease the amount by which a recipient's payments are reduced for support and maintenance from thirty-three and one third percent to ten percent, and to continue on a permanent basis the provision making supplemental security income recipients eligible for food stamps.

summary.text: Provides, under title XVI of the Social Security Act, for emergency assistance grants to recipients of supplemental security income benefits. Authorizes cost-of-living increases in such benefits and in State supplementary payments. Prevents reductions in such benefits because of social security increases. Provides reimbursement to States for home relief payments to disabled applicants prior to determination of their disability. Decreases the amount by which a recipient's payments are reduced for support and maintenance from 33 1/3 percent to 10 percent. Continues on a permanent basis the provision making supplemental security income recipients eligible for food stamps.

titles.title: A bill to amend title XVI of the Social Security Act to provide for emergency assistance grants to recipients of supplemental security income benefits, to authorize cost-of-living increases in such benefits and in State supplementary payments, to prevent reductions in such benefits because Food stamp plan of social security increases, to provide reimbursement to States for home relief payments to disabled applicants prior to determination of their disability, to decrease the amount by which a recipient's payments are reduced for support and maintenance from thirty-three and one third percent to ten percent, and to continue on a permanent basis the provision making supplemental security income recipients eligible for food stamps.
